body_html:
Yes, I was also dumbfounded as I could make everything work without docker. And with docker, everything seems fine. Tensorflow/keras all work fine for me. Unfortunately as I'm not aware of the internals of pytorch. The only thing I can think of is that a previous version gets pulled in from the build file.
…
On Wed, Jul 12, 2017 at 1:00 PM, Soumith Chintala ***@***.***> wrote: @mackiem <https://github.com/mackiem> i cant reproduce it myself. One thing that'd help is if you post your docker build log. By default, the Dockerfile does find CUDA, so this is surprising / weird. — You are receiving this because you were mentioned. -- Regards, Tharindu blog: http://mackiemathew.com/

body:
Yes, I was also dumbfounded as I could make everything work without docker.
And with docker, everything seems fine. Tensorflow/keras all work fine for
me.

Unfortunately as I'm not aware of the internals of pytorch. The only thing
I can think of is that a previous version gets pulled in from the build
file.

On Wed, Jul 12, 2017 at 1:00 PM, Soumith Chintala <notifications@github.com>
wrote:

> @mackiem <https://github.com/mackiem> i cant reproduce it myself. One
> thing that'd help is if you post your docker build log.
> By default, the Dockerfile does find CUDA, so this is surprising / weird.
>
> —

> .
>



-- 
Regards,

Tharindu
